Then you need to describe your company with information such as what type of legal structure it has , history , etc .

Wait , there ' s more ! Then you need to introduce and describe your goods or services . What they are and how they are different from competitors ' ? Then comes the hard part , a market analysis . You need to investigate and analyze hundreds of variables ! You need to take into consideration socioeconomic factors from GDP per capita to how many children on average the population has ! All this information is useful so that you can move on to your strategy and implementation stage , where you will describe in detail how you will actually execute your idea .

Almost , the most important piece of information for your investors will be the financial analysis . Here you will calculate and estimate sales , cash flow and profits . After all , people will want to know when they will begin to see a return on their investment !
I think I ' ll just stick to my old job and save myself all the hassle of trying to start up a business !

tr_5251.speaker: A
tr_5251.utterance: That ' s right ! We apply CPR in the case of cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest .

tr_5251.speaker: A
tr_5251.utterance: Well , basically if your heart stops pumping blood , or your lungs stop pumping air , then we need to get them going again ! That ' s when we have to apply this procedure . Let ' s begin ! I need a volunteer .

tr_5251.explanation: The person is excited to become a volunteer
expanded emotion cause span: I need a volunteer .

tr_5251.speaker: A
tr_5251.utterance: Alright , come here and lay flat on your back . Let ' s suppose this young woman has stopped breathing . tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: What are we going to do ? I can't get the car out of this ditch . I'm stuck !
expanded emotion cause span: I can't get the car out of this ditch . I'm stuck !

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: I'm worried , Tom . I haven't seen any other cars for almost an hour .

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: I know . This is terrible . What can we do ? This snow doesn't stop falling !
expanded emotion cause span: I can't get the car out of this ditch . I'm stuck !
This snow doesn't stop falling !

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: I told you we should have stayed in town today . The weather report said 100 percent chance of snow . Why did you want to come up here ?

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: I wanted to show you the cabin . We only had another half-hour to go .

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: Well , now we're stuck . What can we do ?

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: I don't know .

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: I've heard that when this happens , it's important to save energy .

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: What do you mean ?

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: We're stranded here , Tom . We may be here a long time . We need to conserve the gas in the car . The car's energy is what will keep us warm .

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: I have plenty of gas .

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: Yes , but the gas and the battery both have to stay working . We can't just let the car run and run . If we do , it will die soon . Then we'll freeze .

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: So what can we do ?

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: Turn the lights off . Then , run the car and the heater only about fifteen minutes every hour . That will conserve the heat as long as possible .

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: Alright . That's a good idea .
expanded emotion cause span: That will conserve the heat as long as possible .

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: I wish we hadn't come up here . Now we'll probably be here for days .

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: Days ?
expanded emotion cause span: we'll probably be here for days .

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: Yes , it happens . That is what happens in big snowstorms . People get stranded for days .

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: Oh , my God ! It's good we have food .
expanded emotion cause span: It's good we have food .

tr_2210.speaker: B
tr_2210.utterance: Probably we'll survive . But turn the car off for about forty-five minutes . Then we'll turn it on again .

tr_2210.speaker: A
tr_2210.utterance: Okay , I'll follow your advice .

tr_4999.speaker: A
tr_4999.utterance: They don't just randomly stick you , they find your pressure points . The heat allows the body to immediately respond to the treatment , restoring the body's " chi " .

tr_4999.speaker: A
tr_4999.utterance: The needles are very thin , and as long as the doctor's technique is good , and the patient himself is relaxed , it won't hurt-on the contrary it will actually alleviate pain . Now there are high-tech needles that are micro thin ; they don't hurt at all . However , if you are really scared of acupuncture , scraping or cupping are also options .

tr_4999.speaker: B
tr_4999.utterance: Scraping is too terrifying . When they finish scrapping , your body is all red , as if you were just tortured . Cupping is the same , your body ends up with red circles all over . It looks like someone beat you up .

tr_4999.speaker: B

tr_4999.speaker: A

tr_7427.utterance: Jacob , you have the luxury of having a haircut that rarely needs styling . I don ' t . I have to set aside about an hour and a half to get ready in the mornings . Every day , I wake up and head straight for the shower . Every second day , I wash my hair . If it ' s a hair-washing day , I frequently need to wash my hair twice because it gets really oily . Then I usually put in a conditioner and have to rinse that out too . Because my hair is so long , I seldom manage to take a shower in under twenty minutes . Afterwards , I often put on a pot of coffee and get dressed while I wait for it to brew . I take a long time to get dressed in the morning . Every now and then I remember to choose my outfit the night before , but usually I do it in the morning . In all , getting dressed takes about half an hour , at which time my hair is now semi-dry so then I have to style my hair . From time to time I ' ll put my hair up , but oftentimes I bloody it straight . And then , because of the texture of my hair , I regularly have to flat-iron it to keep it from frizzing .
